Based on the user's preferences and cues, I would recommend two movies: "The Alamo" and "Valkyrie".
"The Alamo" is a historical drama film directed by Peter Weir. The movie is based on the true story of the Battle of the Alamo in 1836, Texas.
The Battle of the Alamo was fought between 24 February – 6 March 1836, between Mexican and American forces during the War of 1812.
The battle ended with a total of 105 casualties, including 89 Mexican soldiers, 13 American soldiers, 3 civilians and 11 horses.
Valkyrie is a 2008 British-American war drama film directed by Steven Spielberg. The movie tells the story of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II.
